mil5.3.3:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil5.3.3:1.1_0: “She’s spoken by a dragon who spoke like this:
mil5.3.3:10.1_0: Hasn’t the Realized One—whether senior, middle, or junior—think that gentleman of the gods, Māra—were to see you.
mil5.3.3:10.2_0: Since he many ways the Realized One is beautiful, eight-faceted, inaction, and hooking the doctrines of others. He shows it to you.
mil5.3.3:10.3_0: this is how the Realized One knows the ways.
mil5.3.3:11.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One has thrown out from a pot. He’s nephew, miserable and sad, with tearful face. He gave a bad destiny, where he accumulates.
mil5.3.3:12.1_0: Furthermore, a Realized One can answer a question about the six classes of answering: ‘Lody, the third, and the fourth. He will be honored, respected, esteemed, revered, and venerated by those nuns.’
mil5.3.3:12.2_0: For this is how the Realized One knows the sense doors.”
mil5.3.3:13.1_0: “It’s good, sir. You’ve been sentenced by the multiplying tendencyize with many different ascetics and brahmins. For it’s good if you divided into the road, providing the ascetics of other religions, for you to take part in debate, and you’ve never spoke of the ascetics of other religions.”
mil5.3.3:3.1_0: Furthermore, the Realized One sits down in front of the four assemblies, and he shows him the way to Kela, saying,
mil5.3.3:3.2_0: And he told him about this.
mil5.3.3:3.3_0: ‘May I applaud the restraint of Sela—that’s what they did. What’s presented, what’s wrong for him?
mil5.3.3:3.4_0: if within a brahmin, you’ll give up that cloth, and then what was wrong, saying, ‘Because’,’ and also do restraint for the wrong effort.
mil5.3.3:3.5_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be kept for you.”
mil5.3.3:4.1_0: “Great king, when the Buddha has spoken, they requested Sela did so, they would give an invitation to eat more cloth for that brahmin.
mil5.3.3:4.2_0: Because when the Buddha has arisen in the Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha brings him down, it’s the demonstration of psychic power.”
mil5.3.3:5.1_0: “Sir, it’s the point of a sound of drums, since he sees that the normal powers of that statement, and the rest is not the same.
mil5.3.3:5.2_0: Please just go ahead with the Sangha.”
mil5.3.3:5.3_0: “But since you have been seen, great king, that man is surrounded by you.”
mil5.3.3:5.5_0: “Let the assembly seems by that feeling, great king, since he feels pleasant feeling.”
mil5.3.3:5.7_0: “In the same way, great king, whatever has arisen in the Realized One is made up by a mortification.
mil5.3.3:6.1_0: Or suppose a person was to take some whether they saw some things that they had come to be, great king, would they see it?”
mil5.3.3:6.2_0: Because that wouldn’t have a responsibility for what has come to be.”
mil5.3.3:6.3_0: “In the same way, when the Realized One has arisen in the Realized One—deep, obstructions are eliminated, and obliterate them—that’s what the Realized One shows them to this body.”
mil5.3.3:7.1_0: “It’s hard for the Buddha to give this cloth to Nāgadatta; even though the Buddha kept it up, I still show it to him.”
mil5.3.3:7.2_0: “Great king, the Buddha doesn’t show the cows to me, but if he shows it to him.”
mil5.3.3:7.3_0: “Sir, is still alive. But the secret one who has seen you have come to the conclusion.”
mil5.3.3:7.4_0: “Great king, a clever person does not wake up to sentient beings.
mil5.3.3:7.5_0: ‘If a Realized One became frightened, then the Realized One would not purify sentient beings.
mil5.3.3:7.6_0: But because a Realized One is able to purify sentient beings, to get rid of that. And because he knows that he is able to purify sentient beings, to get rid of that kindness.
mil5.3.3:8.1_0: know, great king, when you surge, go to medicine, and sit, then fight with arrow, where you feel inspired.
mil5.3.3:8.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One is able to purify sentient beings from arms.
mil5.3.3:9.1_0: But when a woman, because she was deluded by abiding, she shows her way to her.
mil5.3.3:9.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One is capable of realizing anything that can be realized by his psychic power, I infer this way.
mil5.3.3:9.3_0: no person called an arrogant man.
mil5.3.3:9.4_0: whether the Buddha has seen him with his heart!’
